_description: Dialogue between ‘Natura hominis’ and ‘Bonitas dei’ — fourteen 8-line stanzas

BodTan110.First Lines:
Saluator mundi domineTo the Ihesu make I my
                    moon…
BodTan110.Last Lines:
…ffor ther in Ioye shalt thou now beAne euermore throgh my
                    Mercye
BodTan110.Attributed Title: Maria Ihesus Iohannes (f. 238), Amen . Deo gracias (at the end)

CamGon84.First Lines:
Salvator mundi domine to þe Jhesu make I my mone to haue
                    mercyThorow þi pyte gracius god now here my bone…
CamGon84.Last Lines:
…Into my kyndam cum now with me & to þe blysse of hewen on
                    hyeffor þere in ioy schal þu now be & ewur more thorowe my
                    mercy
CamGon84.Note:
13 x 4, aabb with internal rhyme, or 13 x 8 ababcdcd, with refrain
                    phrase, ‘I cry mercy’ or occasionally other phrase ending
                    ‘mercy’ ending last line of each stanza.
CamGon84.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 164-8.
